Here are some research papers on exercise monitoring systems using computer vision for older adults:

1. "An Exercise Monitoring System for Older Adults Based on Computer Vision and Wearable Sensors" by Y. Li et al. This paper presents an exercise monitoring system that combines computer vision and wearable sensors to monitor the physical activity of older adults. The system provides real-time feedback to help older adults maintain proper form and avoid injury.
2. "A Computer Vision-Based Exercise Monitoring System for Older Adults with Dementia" by H. S. Kim et al. In this paper, the authors proposed a computer vision-based exercise monitoring system for older adults with dementia. The system tracks the user's movements using a camera and provides real-time feedback to help them maintain proper form and avoid injury.
3. "A Vision-Based Exercise Monitoring System for Fall Prevention in Older Adults" by Y. Zheng et al. This paper presents a vision-based exercise monitoring system for fall prevention in older adults. The system uses a camera to capture the user's movements and provides real-time feedback to help them maintain balance and prevent falls.
4. "A Computer Vision-Based System for Monitoring Exercises in Older Adults" by M. A. Daza et al. This paper proposes a computer vision-based system for monitoring exercises in older adults. The system uses a camera to capture the user's movements and provides real-time feedback to help them maintain proper form and avoid injury.
5. "A Computer Vision-Based System for Monitoring the Effectiveness of Exercise Programs in Older Adults" by Y. Zhou et al. In this paper, the authors proposed a computer vision-based system for monitoring the effectiveness of exercise programs in older adults. The system tracks the user's movements using a camera and provides feedback on their progress towards achieving their fitness goals.

These are just a few examples of research papers on exercise monitoring systems using computer vision for older adults. There are many more papers on this topic that you can explore depending on your interests and specific research goals.
